refnamediv.refpurpose: Menu: Transform a regular Super Block into an atomic one

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A regular Super Block is just a graphical facility to make diagrams more readable and modular. When such Super Block exists in a diagram the compilation process replace them by their flat equivalent. It is some time interesting to consider a Super Block as an atomic block (treated by the editor and the compiler as a single elementary block)
This menu applies to a single selected Super Block, transforming it into an atomic superblock.
In the current version the transformation to an atomic super block uses the code generation tool.

refsection.title: Remarks
refsection.para: If the Super Block contains continuous time states, The atomic super block calls a fixed step ODE solver to integrate the ODE part of the diagram. Consequently the behavior of the generated simulation function may not be exactly similar to the original super block.

If the super block has several activation input ports the behavior of the atomic super block may not be exactly similar to the original super block due to different handling of asynchronous activations.
